content: We Long for Light but Sink into Darkness
There’s nothing wrong with God; the wrong is in
Your hands are drenched in blood,
No one speaks up for the right,
They trust in illusion, they tell lies,
They hatch snake eggs and weave spider webs.
The spider webs are no good for shirts or shawls.
They compete in the race to do evil
They plan and plot evil, think and breathe evil,

“As for me,”  says, “this is my covenant with them: My Spirit that I’ve placed upon you and the words that I’ve given you to speak, they’re not going to leave your mouths nor the mouths of your children nor the mouths of your grandchildren. You will keep repeating these words and won’t ever stop.” ’s orders.
